metadata.synopsis: In this scene, a dragonborn bard, Quil Grootslang arrives unannounced at the player's camp.The player can tell them to leave or let them stay, but in either case in the next dialogue Quil will be dead.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Choose Dark Urge in CC. Start game. In Camp debug book,Kill Alfira (S_DEN_Bard).Queue Camp Night, keep scrolling until you get to NIGHT_DarkUrge_MurderOfAlfira. Click on it, close the menu and end the day.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: What kind of music do you write?

37.speaker: Quil Grootslang
37.text: I've prepared a dense manuscript of new love-chants, to be throat-sung in Tymanther style.

27.speaker: Quil Grootslang
27.text: I know we must marry into whichever clan suits our own. And I know we're not allowed to let love drive us,

40.speaker: Quil Grootslang
40.text: But I've never even been kissed and I can't stop myself from dreaming.

14.speaker: Quil Grootslang
14.text: I don't think most of us stop hoping, ever, really. Not even when duty stamps us down.

15.speaker: Quil Grootslang
15.text: And that's what the songbook's about. Lost lost, lingering love, never acted on. Never spoken.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I don't think I've ever even been to our homeland... I know nothing of our clans.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: So you ran away from home?

74.speaker: Quil Grootslang
74.text: My clan-name has been struck. I named myself anew after a long-dead poet.

16.speaker: Quil Grootslang
16.text: Perhaps. But I want to capture this feeling, while it still strikes hot.

87.speaker: Quil Grootslang
87.text: You probably don't know, but the dragonborn clans arrange their children's marital unions. Love is considered irrelevant to egg-duty.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Why were you travelling on the road, in the middle of the night?

4.speaker: Quil Grootslang
4.text: I've been given a great chance. My song-score: Affairs in Ancient Abeir: Songs of Draconic Love is due to be published in the Gate!

23.speaker: Quil Grootslang
23.text: I'm in a big big rush, though. I fear that if I don't get there in the next few days they're gonna print some kobold bone-flute instrumentals instead.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: How do you write love songs, if you've never found love yourself?

81.speaker: Quil Grootslang
81.text: Is there someone who you think you might love? Come on, I won't tell.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Astarion might be the most perfect being to ever walk the day.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Mock me as you will, but I have a thing for Gale.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I'll never meet another like Lae'zel, that's for sure.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Wyll is such a gentleman, I imagine he'd make an even better partner.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Karlach seems like she has so much love to give, if she found the right person.

57.speaker: Quil Grootslang
57.text: And have you said so? Do they know even one little bit of how you really feel?

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I'll tell them when I'm sure they'll say it back.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: No, and I'm not sure if I'll ever be able to tell them.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I think they hardly know I exist.

31.speaker: Quil Grootslang
31.text: There's a special feeling to having love all to yourself, don't you think? For no one to know.

8.speaker: Quil Grootslang
8.text: I grew up smiling about my little secrets to myself. I would have been laughed at if I admitted to anyone how I felt. It is not our kind's way.

18.speaker: Quil Grootslang
18.text: But I have my whole life ahead of me... Things will be different now I'm on the Sword Coast. I can't wait for what is coming next!

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I've been honest enough, so far.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: My mind and loins are captive to thoughts of Halsin.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I met the most amazing, bewildering Drow the other day...

5.speaker: Player
5.text: My head is on my shoulders, not in the clouds.

54.speaker: Quil Grootslang
54.text: Well, your life is poorer for it.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Will you sing a draconic song for me?

41.speaker: Quil Grootslang
41.text: Oh my! Are you sure? Are you really sure!

61.speaker: Player
61.text: What's the worst that could happen?

19.speaker: Quil Grootslang
19.text: Spoken like someone who's never heard a dragonborn throatsong.

9.speaker: Quil Grootslang
9.text: This one, Sky-Swain  is about what it might feel like to mate in the air, in the age where wings were yet with us.
9.context: NodeContext: Intake of breath at the end of it.

78.speaker: Quil Grootslang
78.context: NodeContext: As dischordant and unpleasant to listen to as one can imagine

65.speaker: Quil Grootslang
65.context: NodeContext: Like clawing nails down a chalkboard

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Ah, the true language of love.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: That's quite enough culture for one evening!

58.speaker: Quil Grootslang
58.text: Oh, there are sixty nine more verses, I'm only just beginning!
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: As it ends, fade out to allow the player to escape

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Well, I'm sure it's of anthropological interest to someone.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Erm, on second thoughts, let's go to sleep.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Are you any good in a fight?

75.speaker: Quil Grootslang
75.text: Pfft. It's a miracle I'm still alive!

66.speaker: Quil Grootslang
66.text: Hark! Hark! A camp, and, Oghma-willing, some friendly faces.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found the player's camp. Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

2.speaker: Quil Grootslang
2.text: Well met. Goblins roughed me up and stole my hose when they heard me singing Hatchling Love.

59.speaker: Quil Grootslang
59.text: You wouldn't have half a bedroll for a lost minstrel, would you? I can pay for my board with music, if you care for it?

39.speaker: Quil Grootslang
39.text: 'Sides, it's hardly ever I meet another with scales as lovely as mine. You're the kind of gorgeous I dreamed of nesting with as a girl.

76.speaker: Quil Grootslang
76.text: Quil Grootslang, soon to be published in the songbook Affairs in Ancient Abeir: Songs of Draconic Love. If I make it to Baldur's Gate with my manuscript, that is.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: It's dangerous out there to be travelling on your own...

44.speaker: Quil Grootslang
44.text: Sigh. I know. It's not the first time I've been robbed, I am only glad I didn't get hurt.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Our hearth is open, and there is safety beside it.

68.speaker: Quil Grootslang
68.text: I'll just stay one night, promise, then I'll be gone. I know I'm ice-blood, but I get cold so fast, I need to be by the fire.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You're very far from our people's home.

11.speaker: Quil Grootslang
11.text: Well, in all honesty, I ran from Tymanther to avoid my egg-duty.

45.speaker: Quil Grootslang
45.text: Hardly a soul on the Sword Coast has heard our kind's love chants. I've made a fair bit of coin performing them.

42.speaker: Quil Grootslang
42.text: Although half the time it's for some Society of Brilliance twat with two left feet writing a book about us.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You can't stay - I have no time for weaklings.

7.speaker: Quil Grootslang
7.text: But- agh, I have worked for years on my music, I just have to bring my songbook safely to Baldur's Gate.

13.speaker: Quil Grootslang
13.text: I can't risk another night in the open - the goblins might steal my manuscript next time. Surprised they didn't take it when they lifted my poulaines.

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: Invite her in, cast her out. I see no difference either way.

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: Never say no to a bard. They'll write all sorts of mean shit about you.
21.context: NodeContext: with a subtext of 'duh', then with a soft kindness toward Alfira, who she's met before.

1.speaker: Quil Grootslang
1.text: Please, oh, please. It would mean so much to me.
1.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

38.speaker: Quil Grootslang
38.text: Yes! Thank you - I'll write your name in the dedication!
38.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Stay at the edge of the camp, and stay quiet.

50.speaker: Quil Grootslang
50.text: Ah, you're a fearsome one! Fine by me, I'll get some shut-eye. Although I do sometimes whistle when I snore...

71.speaker: Quil Grootslang
71.text: Fine... if I must... but there's trouble out there, and I don't have so much as a butterknife on me.
71.context: NodeContext: player has refused to let her stay - aboslutely gutted

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: Oh, but she seems such a delight! Let her stay, at least for the night.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: Oh, let her stay. What's the worst that could happen?

72.speaker: Gale
72.text: She hardly seems a danger to us. Let the girl stay, if she's desperate enough to think our troupe good company.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: Gods, let her stay if she shuts the hells up.
